Intervention.evidence: subjects received 5 minutes of either stimulation or sham

Objective.evidence: The purposes of this proof-of-concept study were to demonstrate the feasibility of using percutaneous sciatic nerve PNS to treat postoperative pain following ambulatory foot surgery

Method_Outcome.evidence: pain scores decreased to 52% of baseline

Number_Analysed.evidence: pain scores decreased to 52% of baseline (n = 7)

Result_Outcome.evidence: pain scores decreased to 52% of baseline

Harms.evidence: One lead dislodged, 2 fractured during use, and 1 fractured during intentional withdrawal

Trial_Registration.evidence: This study was registered at Clinicaltrials.gov, identifier NCT02898103
